title: Version bump to v0.1.0
body: Bump to version v0.1.0

title: Version upgrades
body: this was triggered by trying to update to ENR v0.6.2. All the changes done are required simply by trying to update this dep

title: Fix a double-lock bug in update_local_enr_socket
body:
There are two double-lock bugs in `update_local_enr_socket`.
`local_enr` is RwLock.
The first read lock:
https://github.com/sigp/discv5/blob/878ef13378017bd8e5bf6426f23c3bf02f9e427d/src/discv5.rs#L353
The second write locks:
1. https://github.com/sigp/discv5/blob/878ef13378017bd8e5bf6426f23c3bf02f9e427d/src/discv5.rs#L371-L373
2. https://github.com/sigp/discv5/blob/878ef13378017bd8e5bf6426f23c3bf02f9e427d/src/discv5.rs#L376-L378

The fix is to replace the first read lock with one write lock,
and reuse the write lock.

title: Update rust before running clippy and check-rustdoc-links
introduce more asserts to clean up some code
Small improvement for the `Discv5Event::SocketUpdated` event
body: Make `Discv5Event::SocketUpdated` happen only when updating local ENR has been succeeded.

title: ENRs for Discv5
body:
This adds a brief outline for our design decision to drop requests from implementations that advertise non-contactable addresses in their ENR.

This issue continually comes up, so I think its necessary we add it to our README.

title: Add Discv5Event::SessionEstablished to surface ENRs
body:
Closes #96.

Add a new `Discv5Event` variant to surface ENRs from established sessions (completed handshakes). This change essentially propagates the `HandlerOut::Established` event upward so that the application layer can receive the event. The propagated ENR does not go through the "contactable" check performed in `inject_session_established`. Therefore, the application has no guarantee that the ENR from this event is contactable.

The discussion in the associated issue suggested this path to resolution. If `SessionEstablished` does not represent desired semantics, then please suggest a more appropriate name.

title: Correct Handshake race condition
body:
Attempt to handle issues raised by @ackintosh here: https://github.com/ackintosh/test-plan-discv5/pull/13#issuecomment-1120430861

From what I can tell it seems we attempt new handshakes even when one is underway. 

To address this, I think we can prevent sending messages if we are awaiting a challenge response. We wait for either the response, or a timeout before sending the message and optionally establishing a new session. 

This way, it should work the first go, and we don't have to increment the number of retries.

@ackintosh - Could you check to see if this PR resolves your issue. (Sorry for the delay, have a few things going on).

title: Bump discv5 version
body: to address the changes of #112

title: Gracefully handle queries that contain the target
body:
Queries that contain a target attempt to contact the target to search for itself.

Previously this resulted in an RPC error as highlighted in #108. 

This PR permits these RPC requests and adds the target in the found closest peers, if that peer is contactable.

title: Ipv6 support
body: Continuation of #107 (see https://github.com/sigp/discv5/pull/107#issuecomment-1118820216 )

title: include clippy for all features in github workflows
enforce clippy in workflows

Enforce contactable nodes

title: Replace hashset delay with crate

title: Update licence in cargo to match repository
body: Update the cargo.toml licence to match that of the repository

title: Public kbuckets access and bucket index
body:
In [Trin](https://github.com/ethereum/trin), we are manually managing the overlay instance of the routing table (`KBucketsTable<TNodeId, TVal: Eq>`) and the buckets (`Vec<KBucket<TNodeId, TVal>>`). For example, we are using a custom bucket refresh lookup algorithm which is first picking buckets with index 239-255, then we select a target bucket and generate a random NodeID falling in the target bucket range. (For more details please check this PR: https://github.com/ethereum/trin/pull/213)

To make this possible, we need public access to the `buckets`  field in `KBucketsTable` and a way to check if a random NodeIi falls in a target bucket index (mainly for testing purposes).

Please advise what would be the most convenient way to accomplish this, happy to tweak this PR to meet maintainers' preferences.

title: Version 0.1.0-beta.13
body: This version includes a number of dependency updates that resolve cargo audit issues.

title: Clippy lints and code improvements
body: Fixing some small lints and example errors for the latest rust.

title: Add bandwidth metrics
body: Removes some obsolete and memory-consuming metrics and adds bandwidth usage metrics.

title: Allowing multithreaded Discv5 calls, without locking
body:
We're using `Discv5` in trin, in a multithreaded (async) context. I find it somewhat painful to have to lock the `Discv5` instance to use most of the APIs.

My read is that, internally, `Discv5` already locks the internal values to make for safe multi-threaded usage. I think we can make that apparent/accessible in the API by just converting the `&mut self` to `&self` everywhere possible (basically everywhere except for startup and shutdown, both of which are not a problem for us).

I'm curious what you folks think about this approach, or if you have suggestions for how trin could use a `Discv5` instance across threads without locking it at every invocation.

title: Add getter for RequestId of TalkRequest
body:
Expose the `RequestId` of a `TalkRequest`.

Motivation: Allow protocols built on top of `discv5` to access request IDs of `TalkRequest` for e.g. logging.

title: Prevent adding duplicate nodes
body:
With filters enabled, it was possible (although unlikely) to add duplicate nodes to a bucket. 

This can happy via the following set of actions:

- The bucket becomes full
- A node (call it A) gets added to the pending state of the bucket
- A node gets removed from the bucket for updating state that is incompatible with a filter, making the bucket no longer full
- The node A can then get inserted into the bucket from a new RPC message (as the table is no longer full). This happens before the pending time. 
- The pending timeout expires and the pending node (A) gets inserted in the table as a duplicate

This PR drops the pending node if it already exists in the bucket.

title: Improve error handling and mutability
body: Improves error handling in kbuckets and removes unnecessary mutability in kbucket modifications.

title: Modify nodes_by_distances to take slice arg instead of Vec
body:
Modify `nodes_by_distances` method of `KBucketsTable` to take a slice argument for `log2_distances`.

I'm not sure whether we need to bump the version given it's marked as beta. Also, AFAIK we (trin) are the only consumers of the recently public `kbuckets` module API.

title: Remove mut self from find_enr()
body:
- Removed mut self from find_enr()

So I am making this PR because to my knowledge the mut self isn't required and it will work without mutability. I am not the most knowledgeable in Rust, but it does seem to be unnecessary correct me if I am wrong.

It would be nice to have this not mutable because then you can use it from an Arc reference of the Discv5 Impl.

@AgeManning

title: Re-implement lru-time-cache
Emit warn log when no known_closest_peers found
body: Added warn log to notice users that no known_closest_peers found. And I think it's better to return empty result immediately in the case.

title: Move kbucket into separate DHT crate
body:
- Create workspace with members `discv5` and `discv5-dht`
- Move kbucket into `discv5-dht` package
- Move ConnectionDirection from handler module to kbucket module

In order to build overlay networks on top of discv5, we need to be able to build and manage separate routing tables. To support this, we need the kbucket items to be public.

title: Version 0.1.0-beta.9
body: Building upon https://github.com/sigp/discv5/pull/80, cut a beta.9 release

title: Update for Clippy 1.54.0
body: Remove some unnecessary borrows

title: Update first connected pos in `KBucket::remove`
body:
Modify `KBucket::remove` so that it updates `first_connected_pos` and can no longer be used to violate the internal invariants of the bucket, i.e. ensure that `first_connected_pos` remains correct & in bounds.

I've also added a new quickcheck test that applies random actions from `KBucket`'s public interface in a random order. This should provide us with some reassurance that regardless of how `KBucket`'s methods are used by the rest of the crate, it will never panic. 

The only mutable methods from `KBucket` that are excluded from the new test are `pending_mut` and `get_mut`. The reason for their omission is that they're unrelated to the removal bug, and are limited in the damage they can do (they can't _remove_ bucket entries).

title: Add getter function for node_address
body:
This just adds a getter for node_address: NodeAddress in Impl TalkRequest.

This is useful if you want to send a talk request to a node that sent you one. Because you can find their ENR from it.

title: Fix issues in `update_value`
body:
This PR fixes an issue in `KBucket::update_value` that caused two nodes to be removed rather than one when the filter check failed. It also updates the value of `first_connected_pos` so that it remains consistent in the case of a removal.

Testing has been expanded through a new `quickcheck` test which updates a value in the presence of a filter. I've also re-jigged some of the other quickcheck infra to make use of an `Arbitrary`-aware generator for `NodeId`, and refactored some of the common checks into `KBucket::check_invariants`.

title: Update dependencies
body: This updates dependencies, specifically libp2p which references libsecp256k1 which has a known vulnerability.

title: Downgrade warning log
body:
There are lots of logs for responses that come in late after a query has ended.

This PR downgrades the log to `debug` level to avoid spamming the user.

title: Improve ConfigBuilder
body:
- Adds the ban duration to the configuration builder
- Re-orders some of the configuration options
- Adds a new github action to check doc links

title: Packet Filter improvements
body:
This provides a number of updates/improvements

- Overhauls the packet filter to a more robust implementation of an RPC limiter. The previous implementation had a number of shortcommings with identifying malicious actors efficiently.
- Add a timeout to bans.  If the packet filter is enabled, nodes will be banned for hitting RPC and unsolicited request limits. These bans are no longer permanent and have a configurable default timeout.
- Tokio has been updated to the latest version
- Sessions are no longer removed on timeouts. We keep sessions around as an optimisation to prevent having to re-establish sessions when potentially they are still valid. If the session is invalid, the node should request a new session via a WHOAREYOU.

title: Whoareyou timeout
body:
This is an optimisation that prevents sending WhoAreYouRef requests to the service every time a packet has unknown session keys. 

A WhoAreYouRef is only requested from the service if we are not already waiting for a response. 

Further, this corrects the lrucache such that multiple unknown requests from a node does not restart the WHOAREYOU request timeout.

title: Handful of changes from portal network fork
body:
This PR includes:
 - Refining the API for TalkReq handlers to work better with async consumers.
 - Adding a `nodes_by_distance` method.
 - Relaxing the mutable reference requirement for `table_entries_enr` and `table_entries_id` since they clone their return values anyway.
 - Relaxing ENR restrictions around advertised vs. observed IP address.
 - Ignoring vim swapfiles.

title: Feature update patches
body:
This provides a number of corrections associated with the previous feature update.

Specifically, 
- Correctly handling of inserting pending peers into the routing table
- Adds initial ENRs into the untrusted list to account for cases when peers get removed from the routing table during a query.

title: Feature Update
body:
This update provides a number of core improvements:
- Adds an abstract filter to the local routing table, allowing easier ways to filter entries from being added to the table.  This is currently used for creating limits on IP ranges and incoming/vs outgoing nodes. 
- Introduces the concept of connection direction. Sessions that get established are now tagged with either being ingoing or outgoing. This can be used to limit the number of incoming connections allowed per bucket. 
- Improves and adds some extra filtering logic to harden the security and limit the allowed actions of malicious actors.
- Keeps track of peers to ping individually. Only send pings on an interval on a per-peer basis. 
- Prevent counting IP votes from all peers, rather just those in the routing table.

title: Auto-coerce to ping response to ipv4 when possible
body:
If a peer sends a ping response with an ipv6 address that is ipv4 compatible/mapped, then auto-convert to ipv4.

Related to https://github.com/sigp/discv5/pull/62

title: Add mitigation for ipv6 loop
body:
Attempt to avoid the loop described in https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/issues/2215

The rationale for this change (credits to @pawanjay176) is that [`Enr::udp_socket`](https://docs.rs/enr/0.5.0/src/enr/lib.rs.html#369-376) only returns IPv4 addresses, whilst `IpVote::majority` can return IPv6 addresses. Therefore, when the majority address is an IPv6 address it will never be the case that `Some(majority_socket) != local_socket` and node will consistently attempt to update its address but never consider it successfully updated.

This PR explicitly ignores ipv6 addresses since it is my understanding that the rest of this code base is not ipv6-ready.

Note: I had to run `cargo fmt --all` to appease CI. You'll notice a couple of additional changes in the diff.

title: Dependency update
body:
Updates the dependencies of discv5, in particular:
- ENR
- RLP

The updates contain crypto modifications due to the underlying cryptography library updates

title: Add a `disconnect_node` public method
body: Adds a public method to mark a node as `Disconnected` in the dht.

title: update dependencies
body: most important update is tokio-util to 0.6.2 because it fixes panics in `DelayQueue`

title: Update dependencies
body:
This PR updates the discv5 dependencies. 

It is waiting for a new libp2p version before being merged.

title: Maintain session challenge
body: If a signature is invalid for a specific handshake challenge, we maintain the challenge and allow the correct signature to be requested again
